intro: Tulipa linifolia f. chrysantha, commonly known as the golden thread tulip, is a botanical variant of the tulip species characterized by its delicate, thread-like foliage. This cultivar is prized for its vibrant, golden-yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It is native to Central Asia and thrives in well-drained soil with full sun exposure. The plant typically reaches a height of 10–15 inches, making it suitable for rock gardens or borders. Its compact size and showy blooms make it a popular choice among gardeners seeking ornamental value in smaller spaces.
